frame.name: Eclipse
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Obstruction</fen> blocks an <fen>Eclipsed</fen> entity partially or completely from view. The positions of the <fen>Obstruction</fen> and the <fen>Eclipsed</fen> entity are often reported relative to a <fen>Vantage_point</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Eclipsed">A small green bulb</fex> <t>concealed</t> <fex name="Obstruction">behind the panel</fex> flashed on momentarily .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Obstruction
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity which blocks the <fen>Eclipsed</fen> entity from view.
<ex><fex name="Obstruction">Wispy clouds</fex> <t>shrouded</t> the treetops.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Eclipsed
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity which is blocked from view.
<ex>The mists <t>obscured</t> <fex name="Eclipsed">the top of the tower</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Vantage_point
FE.definition:
<def-root>The position from which an observer, if an observer were present, would have their view of the <fen>Eclipsed</fen> entity blocked by the <fen>Obstruction</fen>.
<ex>The gate <t>screened</t> the house <fex name="VP">from the road</fex>.</ex>
Phrases such as "from view" and "from sight" are assumed to indicate that the <fen>Eclipsed</fen> entity is not visible from any <fen>Vantage_point</fen>.
<ex>The telescope is <t>blocked</t> <fex name="VP">from view</fex> by a big map of Europe.</ex>
This frame element includes direct reference to observers.
<ex>A fence <t>screens</t> the garden <fex name="VP">from passersby</fex>.</ex>.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Eclipsed</fen> entity is blocked from view.
<ex>The bungalow is <fex name="Degree">completely</fex> <t>obscured</t> by thick foliage.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Subregion
FE.definition:
<def-root>The part of the <fex name="Eclipsed">Eclipsed</fex> entity which is blocked from view.
<ex>The gazebo was <t>screened</t> by a hedge <fex name="sub">on one side</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: hide.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: be in a state of obstructing an object from view

lexUnit.name: eclipse.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to completely block an entity from view

lexUnit.name: mask.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: conceal from view

lexUnit.name: cover.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to partially or wholly block an entity from view

lexUnit.name: obscure.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: keep from being seen; conceal

lexUnit.name: screen.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: conceal, protect, or shelter with a screen

lexUnit.name: veil.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: partially conceal, disguise, or obscure

lexUnit.name: hidden.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: blocked from view by another entity

lexUnit.name: blot out.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: obscure a view

lexUnit.name: obscured.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: partially blocked from view by another entity

lexUnit.name: block.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: block an entity from view

lexUnit.name: screened.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: blocked from view as if by a screen

lexUnit.name: masked.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: blocked from view by an entity that alters the aesthetics of the masked entity as if by use of a mask

lexUnit.name: veiled.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: blocked from view as if by a veil

lexUnit.name: covered.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: blocked from view by another entity which completely surrounds the covered entity

lexUnit.name: occlude.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stop, close up, or obstruct

lexUnit.name: cloak.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to block an entity from view as if by use of a cloak

lexUnit.name: shroud.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cover an object completely

lexUnit.name: shrouded.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: blocked from view as if by a shroud

lexUnit.name: cloaked.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: obscured, as if by wearing a cloak

lexUnit.name: eclipse.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an obscuring of the light from one celestial body by the passage of another between it and the observer or between it and its source of illumination

lexUnit.name: occlusion.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: something which blocks an opening

lexUnit.name: occultation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an astronomical event whereby, from the view of an observer, one celestian body blocks the view of another celestial body; a total eclipse.

lexUnit.name: conceal.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: not allow to be seen; hide

lexUnit.name: concealed.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: blocked from view by another entity

lexUnit.name: obstruct.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: block; be in the way of

lexUnit.name: becloud.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to block an entity from view as if obscured by clouds.

lexUnit.name: befog.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to block an entity from view as if obscured by fog

lexUnit.name: beclouded.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: obscured, as if by clouds

lexUnit.name: befogged.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: obscured, as if by fog

lexUnit.name: enshroud.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to obscure or block an entity from view

lexUnit.name: enshrouded.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: obscured, as if by a shroud
